action.primary: Stops excessive sweating due to Deficiency

indications: Spontaneous sweating due to Qi Deficiency
Night sweats due to Yin Deficiency

action.primary: Nourishes the Heart and calms the Spirit

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with sweating due to External invasion.

useCases: Sweating associated with steaming bone disorder.
Night sweats due to Heat from Yin Deficiency.
Night sweats due to Yin Deficiency Heat.
Emotional disorders, disorientation, emotional instability and irritability due to mild Deficiency of the Spleen Qi and Heart Blood.
Treats spontaneous sweating due to Qi Deficiency and night sweats due to Yin Deficiency.

notes: Being sweet, this herb has a Qi tonification property. It tonifies Qi, nourishes the body and treats steaming bones.
This herb tends to tonify Heart Qi, disperse Dampness and clear Heat to eliminate sweating.
This herb is said to treat skin verrucosis, nevus and decayed muscles.
This herb is said to inhibit the growth of cancer cells and kill cancer cells.
It is also said that this herb can clear extreme Heat, cure pestilence, cure jaundice and drunkenness and calm the Small Intestine.
It is reported that 15g of this herb can prevent colorectal cancer.

Both Fu Xiao Mai and Rx. Ephedrae #{MaHuangGen} Ma Huang Gen stop sweating and are often combined to treat spontaneous sweating and night sweats. Fu Xiao Mai augments Qi and clears Heat to stop sweating, while Ma Huang Gen astringes. it has no ability to tonify Qi, cool the Heart or clear Heat.

Wheat (Fr. Tritici) Xiao Mai are the ripe grains that do not float. They are sweet, slightly cold, enter the Heart channel, nourish Heart Qi and eliminate irritability to treat irritability, restlessness and insomnia as in restless organ disorder, for which it is combined with Rx. Glycyrrhizae #{GanCao} Gan Cao and Fr. Jujube #{DaZao} Da Zao.
